00050 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00051     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00052     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00053             : "=r" (word)
00054             : "r"  (word));
00055     return word;
00056 }
00057 
00058 static inline unsigned long long arti_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00059                                               unsigned long uld,
00060                                               unsigned long *r) {
00061     /*
00062      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00063      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00064      * 3.x.
00065      */
00066 
00067     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00068     unsigned long tq, rh;
00069     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00070 
00071     p.ull = ull;
00072     q.ull = 0;
00073     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00074 
00075     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00076         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00077         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00078         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00079         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00080     }
00081 
00082     *r = p.ull;
00083 
00084     return q.ull;
00085 }
00086 
00087 static inline int arti_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00088 
00089     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00090     
00091     int dummy;
00092 
00093     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00094         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00095         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00096         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00097         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00098 
00099     return i;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static inline long long arti_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00103 
00104     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00105 
00106     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00107         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00108         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00109         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00110         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00111         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00112         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00113         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00114         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00115         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00116         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00117         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00118         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00119         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00120         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00121         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00122         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00123         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00124         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00125         "1:\t\n" \
00126         : "=A" (ll) \
00127         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00128         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00129 
00130     return ll;
00131 }

00202 static inline unsigned long long arti_rdtsc (void) {
00203     unsigned long long t;
00204     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));
00205     return t;
00206 }

00257 /* arti_get_current() is Adeos-specific. Since real-time interrupt
00258    handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI domain stack, we cannot
00259    infere the "current" Linux task address using %esp. We must use the
00260    suspended Linux domain's stack pointer instead. */
00261 
00262 static inline struct task_struct *arti_get_current (int cpuid)
00263 
00264 {
00265     int *esp;
00266 
00267     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00268 
00269     if (esp >= arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00270         return (struct task_struct *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL));
00271 
00272     return get_current();
00273 }

00278 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00279 
00280     arti_cli();
00281     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00282 }
00283 
00284 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00285 
00286     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00287     arti_sti();
00288 }

00290 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00291 
00292     unsigned long flags;
00293     arti_local_irq_save(flags);
00294     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00295     return flags;
00296 }

00298 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00299                                              spinlock_t *lock) {
00300     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00301     arti_local_irq_restore(flags);
00302 }

00304 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00305 
00306 #define CPU_RELAX(x) \
00307 do { \
00308    int i = 0; \
00309    do \
00310      cpu_relax(); \
00311    while (++i < x); \
00312 } while(0)
00313 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00314 #define CPU_RELAX(x)
00315 
00316 void arti_broadcast_to_timers(int irq,
00317                               void *dev_id,
00318                               struct pt_regs *regs);
00319 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00321 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void) {
00322 
00323     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00324 
00325     arti_cli();
00326 
00327     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00328         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00329             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00330 }
00331 
00332 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void) {
00333 
00334     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00335 
00336     arti_cli();
00337 
00338     if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock)) {
00339         clear_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock);
00340         CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00341     }
00342 }
00343 
00356 static inline void rt_global_cli(void) {
00357     rt_get_global_lock();
00358 }
00359 
00366 static inline void rt_global_sti(void) {
00367     rt_release_global_lock();
00368     arti_sti();
00369 }
00370 
00377 static inline int rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void) {
00378 
00379     unsigned long flags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli();
00380     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00381 
00382     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00383         {
00384         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00385             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00386 
00387         return flags | 1;
00388         }
00389 
00390     return flags;
00391 }
00392 
00400 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags) {
00401 
00402     unsigned long hflags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli(), rflags;
00403     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00404 
00405     if (test_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00406         rflags = hflags;
00407     else
00408         rflags = hflags | 1;
00409 
00410     if (hflags)
00411         arti_sti();
00412 
00413     *flags = rflags;
00414 }
00415 
00423 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags) {
00424 
00425     switch (flags)
00426         {
00427         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00428 
00429             rt_release_global_lock();
00430             arti_sti();
00431             break;
00432 
00433         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00434 
00435             rt_get_global_lock();
00436             arti_sti();
00437             break;
00438 
00439         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00440 
00441             rt_release_global_lock();
00442             break;
00443 
00444         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00445 
00446             rt_get_global_lock();
00447             break;
00448         }
00449 }
00450 
00451 static inline void rt_switch_to_real_time(int cpuid) {
00452 
00453     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_RT(cpuid);
00454     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = arti_get_current(cpuid);
00455     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags = arti_linux_save_flags_and_cli();
00456     set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00457 }
00458 
00459 static inline void rt_switch_to_linux(int cpuid) {
00460 
00461     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_LINUX(cpuid);
00462     clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00463     arti_linux_restore_flags(arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags);
00464     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = NULL;
00465 }
00466 
00467 static inline struct task_struct *rt_whoislinux(int cpuid) {
00468 
00469     return arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask;
00470 }

00472 static inline int rt_is_linux (void) {
00473 
00474     return !test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_realtime);
00475 }
00476 
00477 static inline int rt_is_lxrt (void) {
00478 
00479     return test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_lxrt);
00480 }

00482 static inline void rt_set_timer_delay (int delay) {
00483 
00484     if (delay) {
00485         unsigned long flags;
00486         arti_hw_lock(flags);
00487 #ifdef __USE_APIC__
00488         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00489         apic_write(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00490 #else /* !__USE_APIC__ */
00491         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00492         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00493 #endif /* __USE_APIC__ */
00494         arti_hw_unlock(flags);
00495     }
00496 }
